docs.title: MeshCore Communities Across Canada
docs.text:
MeshCore Canada is a community index for MeshCore networks across the country. If you run a MeshCore community, this site is where people can discover you.

Below are links to provincial community lists. Each province page includes:

  • Local MeshCore community names
  • Region covered
  • How to join (Discord, Matrix, website, email)
  • Notes about frequencies or special configs

You can help keep this list up to date by submitting a pull request. See Contributing for details.

docs.title: What is MeshCore
docs.text:
MeshCore is a long range, low power mesh protocol built on LoRa radios. Communities use MeshCore to create local and regional off grid communication networks.

Each community has its own governance, hardware recommendations, and expansion plans. This site is only an index that helps people discover their nearest MeshCore group.

If you want to start a new community in your area, you can add it by following the steps in Contributing.

docs.title: How to Request Changes to MeshCore.ca
docs.text:
If you want to add a new MeshCore community or update information for your region, the easiest way is to open a GitHub Issue.

You do not need to know Git, GitHub, or how to edit the website. Just follow the steps below.

docs.title: 1. Go to the Issues page
docs.text:
Visit the MeshCore Canada GitHub repository and click Issues.

Link: https://github.com/MrAlders0n/MeshCore-Canada/issues

docs.title: 2. Click "New Issue"
docs.text:
Choose the template that matches what you want to do:

  • Add a New Community
  • Update Existing Community
  • Fix a Mistake / Small Correction
  • General Request

docs.title: 3. Fill out the form
docs.text:
Provide as much detail as possible. Example:

Community Name: Ottawa MeshCore Province: Ontario Region: Ottawa and surrounding area Contact: https://discord.gg/D89Dn2dnas Status: Active Notes: Using 910.525 MHz, 62.5 kHz, SF7, CR5.

If you're updating an existing entry, mention what changed.

docs.title: 4. Submit the issue
docs.text:
A maintainer will:

  1. Review the request
  2. Make the change
  3. Close the issue when complete

If we need more information, we’ll comment on the ticket.

docs.title: 5. Optional — Advanced Contributions
docs.text:
If you know GitHub and want to edit the markdown files directly:

  1. Fork the repo
  2. Edit the relevant file in docs/provinces/
  3. Open a pull request

See the full contributor guide in contributing.md.

docs.title: Thank You
docs.text: MeshCore.ca is a community-maintained directory, and contributions from all regions help keep the network growing across Canada.

docs.title: MeshCore Communities in Alberta
docs.text: This page lists MeshCore communities in Alberta. If you know of a community that is missing or needs an update, please open a pull request. See Contributing for how to add or update entries.

docs.title: How entries are structured
docs.text:
Each community is listed with:

  • Community name
  • Region or coverage area
  • Contact (Discord, website, Matrix, email, etc.)
  • Status (Active, Forming, Paused)
  • Optional notes like default frequency or special rules

Template 

## Community Name

**Region:** City / area / region  
**Status:** Active | Forming | Paused  

**Contact:**
- Discord: <link>
- Website: <link>
- Other: <link or note>

**Notes:**
- Default MeshCore settings: \<if relevant\>
- Hardware focus: \<if relevant\>
